page.title: 04The Battle of Britain Museum
page.content: The Hawkinge Aeronautical Trust was formed on 11-1-1986 by the amalgamation of Britain Aeronautical Museum,Brenzett,and Kent Battle of Britain Museum,Hawkinge,with the aim of bringing into use as a museum,the historic grounds and building of part of the former RAF Battle of Britain Fighter Station at Hawkinge near Folkestone,Kent.Both museums have been open continuously to the public for the past 10 years. They had developed and expanded upon similar lines,with a common aim to keep alive the spirit of the Nation that stood alone in the time of war, by compiling the day to day events of 1940 from a variety of sources and with the help of eye witnesses and historians.
